snippet: After two years of stalemate on how to spur job creation and slash deficits, the consensus is that fiscal tightening has been a drag on economic recovery.
abstract: Private-sector and government economists say that nation's unemployment rate would probably be nearly a point lower, roughly 6.5 percent, and economic growth almost two points higher in 2013 if federal government had not cut spending and raised taxes as it has since 2011; news bolsters consensus is that fiscal tightening has been drag on economic recovery.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: After two years of stalemate on how to spur job creation and slash deficits, the consensus is that fiscal tightening has been a drag on economic recovery.

headline.seo: Deficit Reduction Is Seen by Economists as Impeding Recovery
headline.main: Economists See Deficit Emphasis as Impeding Recovery
headline.print_headline: Emphasis on Deficit Reduction Is Seen by Economists as Impeding Recovery
